head.title: Courting Michigan, A Mirror of the U.S.

hedline.hl1: Courting Michigan, A Mirror of the U.S.

block.p: In February, Gov. George W. Bush of Texas lost the Michigan Republican primary to Senator John McCain of Arizona, thanks to a notably poor showing among independents, moderates and women.
Seven months later, he is having trouble attracting the same voters in his race against Vice President Al Gore.
In February, Gov. George W. Bush of Texas lost the Michigan Republican primary to Senator John McCain of Arizona, thanks to a notably poor showing among independents, moderates and women.
Seven months later, he is having trouble attracting the same voters in his race against Vice President Al Gore.
With a Bush lead, then a Gore bounce and now bit of a Bush comeback, the presidential race is close in Michigan, a battleground state that is demographically very similar to the United States.
